content: @Hirochika Matsumoto wants to join the wg, cc @apiraino can you lead them on what they need to do?

Sure thing, we've detailed in this topic a little bit how things work:
https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/227806-t-compiler.2Fwg-prioritization/topic/How.20to.20help/near/241751050

Welcome @Hirochika Matsumoto, thanks for volunteering :-) If you have more questions, please let me know (at first, things might not look very clear)

I'll add you to the member roster, so you'll receive notifications when a new topic is opened in #t-compiler/wg-prioritization/alerts

The current list of issues in need of a prioritization is here:
https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3AT-compiler+-label%3AP-critical+-label%3AP-high+-label%3AP-medium+-label%3AP-low+label%3AI-prioritize
most of them are regressions found by crater, a diagnostic tool that compiles about ~170K Rust crates found around the internet to see if a release introduces regressions. We run this tool before each stable release. Priority we assign to these issues depends on various factors (which crate breaks, what kind of Rust code does the crate has, etc.)

... and the PR is up!
https://github.com/rust-lang/team/pull/628

please also @Hirochika Matsumoto review, thanks
Thanks @apiraino for the detailed explanation! I don't have questions for now, but I'll ask you some as I learn by doing

@Hirochika Matsumoto you should now have permissions to apply labels to issues.

(some of us keep a template when assigning the I-priority label, it's really useful)

Can confirm, thanks for all @apiraino !

I actually copied your template when modifying labels of https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/89119 :)
